page.title: 18EFFECTS OF THE MOTORWAY
page.content:
Since the building of the M8 motorway, taking through-traffic away from Paisley town centre traffic congestion has been reduced. The building of the motorway meant that the road links with the rest of the country were much better and this encouraged businesses to be set e.g. Hillington Industrial Estate built next to the motorway.
To a lesser extent the small estate including B&Q and Bridges needs to be next to the motorway so that cust- omers can locate them. It is also an important road for Glasgow Airport.
This has meant that Paisley has a relatively small amount of through- traffic making the shopping streets safer and putting less pressure on narrow roads. It has possibly meant a slump in passing trade for the centre.
